data.enText: She is rarely seen in public nowadays.
We rarely agree on what to do.
data.chText: 我们很少在要做的事情上看法一致。

data.enText: Rarely has a debate attracted so much media attention.
data.chText: 难得有一场辩论吸引这么多的媒体关注。

example.ex: They battled against other Indian tribes, but rarely fought with the whites...
example.tran: 他们同其他印第安部落作战，但很少与白人并肩对敌。

example.ex: I very rarely wear a raincoat because I spend most of my time in a car...
example.tran: 我难得穿一次雨衣，因为大部分时间我都是呆在车里。

example.ex: Money was plentiful, and rarely did anyone seem very bothered about levels of expenditure...
example.tran: 有足够的钱，似乎很难见到有人为花费而烦心。

example.ex: They were rarely seen together and certainly did not travel together...
example.tran: 很少见到他们在一起，当然更不可能一起旅行。

example.ex: Adolescent suicide is rarely an impulsive reaction to immediate distress...
example.tran: 青少年自杀很少是由于突然发生不幸而作出的冲动反应。

example.ex: Rarely does a grand jury publicly disagree with a prosecutor.
example.tran: 大陪审团公开反对公诉人意见的情况很少见。

gramarinfo.label: ADV before v, ADV with cl/group

value.def: If something rarely happens, it does not happen very often.

partsOfSpeech.d: (强调真实无误)绝对地，完全地
紧密地；接近地；仔细地；严密地；精密地

partsOfSpeech.dec: con- 共同, 一起 + sequ 跟随 + -ent ...的 + -ly ...地
con- 共同, 一起 + vers  转 + -e + -ly ...地
exclusive adj.排除其他一切的 + -ly ...地
fortun(e) 运气 + -ate 具有...的 + -ly ...地
free adj.不受他人控制的 + -ly ...地
increas(e) 增加 + -ing 形容词后缀 + -ly ...地
read(y) 预备好了的状态 + -ly ...地

partsOfSpeech.d: (对自己的话很有把握，希望他人同意)想必

partsOfSpeech.dec: un- 否定 + like 像 + -ly ...地
in- 不,无 + variabl(e) 可变的 + -ly ...地

partsOfSpeech.d: (引出新话题、附加信息、或临时想到的问题)顺便提一句

partsOfSpeech.dec: literal adj.按字面常用意义理解的 + -ly ...地
